definition: René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

pinyin: Di2 ka3 er2 zuo4 biao1 zhi4

sentences.english: Descartes' thought is the starting point of the life science afterworld.
sentences.chinese: 笛卡儿的思想是其后世生命科学发展的出发点。

sentences.english: Descartes replies to this with his deceiving God argument.
sentences.chinese: 笛卡儿答复这他的欺骗上帝争论。

sentences.english: It is conventional for most cartesian coordinate systems to be right-handed.
sentences.chinese: 习惯上最常使用的笛卡儿座标系统是右手。

sentences.english: In Wittgenstein's works, there is not a single work which does not mention Descartes.
sentences.chinese: 维特根斯坦在其著述中，没有一处提到过笛卡儿。

sentences.english: Descartes's solution of a depressed quarto equation employs the method of undetermined coefficients .
sentences.chinese: 笛卡儿的分解四次方程的解法采用待定系数。

definition: Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Leibniz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Francis Bacon (1561-1626), English Renaissance philosopher and early scientist
pinyin: Fu2 lan2 xi1 si1 · Pei2 gen1

definition: Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
